definition: thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions

sentences.english: VCs don't want these shares; instead, they want preferred stock.
sentences.chinese: 風投並不想要這些股份，相反，它們想要的是優先股。

sentences.english: About 10% of the fund's portfolio reflects Freddie and Fannie preferred stock.
sentences.chinese: “兩房”優先股佔該基金投資組合的10%左右。

sentences.english: That means no preferential shares and no venture investors.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着不存在優先股和風險投資。

sentences.english: To reduce risk, you can invest in a diversified group of preferreds.
sentences.chinese: 爲降低風險，你也可以選擇投資多種行業的優先股。

sentences.english: Many preferreds are issued by banks.
sentences.chinese: 許多優先股是由銀行發行的。

sentences.english: After five years, any remaining preferred shares would convert to common shares.
sentences.chinese: 五年後，任何剩餘的優先股將轉換爲普通股。

sentences.english: The redeemable preference shares are redeemable seven years after their date of issue at par value.
sentences.chinese: 可贖回優先股可於發行日期後七年內按面值贖回。

pinyin: shou3 ci4 gong1 kai1 zhao1 gu3

definition: to issue/to distribute/to publish along with
remittance/funds paid to a bank account
debt security/collateralized debt obligation (CDO), type of bond
to underwrite (i.e. guarantee financing)/underwriting/to sell as agent/consignee
consideration (in exchange for shares)/a quid pro quo
(of a sum of money etc) receivable
